title.rendered: Automation Hour 2021: Einstein Bot Flows &  Omni-Channel Routing

content.rendered:
Overview

Declarative is easier to maintain. Apex with more minute detail flexibility, more options and faster but it’s more difficult to maintain and takes more work. You can launch a flow with some Apex, or my favorite, last but not least, you could avoid deciding and create an Apex Action to use in Flow (or perhaps there is a legit use case here like external services ;-). Whatever way, make sure that it’s built where others understand and you can modify and grow, then you’ll get to fancy rockstar when you get to fancy rockstar.

Presenter

Meighan is a technical architect with over 14 years of experience in design and implementation in complex application architecture, design, and construction. She has successfully completed projects for Boston Scientific, GE, Aristocrat, and many more. Meighan’s responsibilities over her career include team lead, chief architect, solution design and developer.

Along with her leadership role, where she handles coaching and mentoring her team and coworkers about leveraging of best practices for Salesforce implementation, Meighan is also active in the community. She created and administers OhanaSlack (a workspace for real time Salesforce help), leads the Women in Tech Seattle User Group, co-hosts System Dot Debug (a Salesforce Developer Podcast), founded and leads RoadToCTA Salesforce Saturday, coaches for Merivis, and speaks at a variety of Salesforce Events. You can find out more about her community activities on her Salesforce socials here.

  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • LinkedIn
  • YouTube
  • WordPress
  • GitHub

YouTube Recording

Einstein Bot Developer Cookbook

excerpt.rendered: Curious about Einstein Bots, Flow, or the new Omni-Channel Routing functionality? In this episode of Automation Hour, you’ll learn about AI and all of that inside of Salesforce from Technical Architect & Salesforce MVP, Meighan Brodkey.
